{"step_by_step_thinking": "The patient is a 7-year-old girl with a single tooth crossbite. According to Document [11], single tooth anterior dental crossbite is a common malocclusion during the development of occlusion in children. Various treatment options such as removable and fixed appliances have been suggested. The paper presents two cases of anterior crossbite corrected using the standard Catlan's appliance (Lower Inclined Bite Plane) in a short period of three weeks without any damage to the tooth or the periodontium. This fixed appliance is a simple and traditional method which does not depend on patient cooperation to reverse the bite. Therefore, immediate intervention therapy would be the most appropriate treatment plan for this patient.", "answer_choice": "C"}
